go_data.justification: RDS is critical for photoreceptor disc rim assembly, outer segment orientation, photoreceptor structural stability, and OS disc renewal.
RDS expression and localization to the distal connecting cilium in the mouse rod photoreceptor cell begin around postnatal day 5, before OS formation.
Expression of at least 80% of the normal amount of RDS is necessary in order to build proper photoreceptor OSs.
RDS is known to form homomeric complexes as well as heteromeric complexes with a related tetraspanin protein, rod outer segment membrane protein 1 (ROM-1).
